intro: Burchardia umbellata var. strictiflora, commonly known as the narrow-flowered burchardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically blooms in the spring, producing white or pale blue flowers that are attractive to pollinators. It prefers moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Its compact form and ornamental flowers make it a valued addition to native gardens and conservation areas.
